1.heading: Lawns.
1.title: The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55
1.author: [No author]

2.title: Lawns
2.author: by Bob and Bert.
notes: Summary: A bearded man asleep on the lawn gets run over by a lawnmower.
Wordless strip.

3.title: Lawns
3.author: B
notes: Summary: Sappo decides to change his lawn to all dandelions.
Side feature: "Popeye's Seedless Raisins" (Play-Store).

4.title: Lawns
4.author: by BZ.
notes: Summary: Sappo has a great time knocking the heads off the dandelions in his lawn with his golf club, but then they're all gone.

5.title: Lawns
5.author: J
notes: Summary: Everybody's been falling over the fence that's supposed to protect the newly planted lawn.

6.title: Lawns
6.author: by Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Pop's using the push mower with two kids riding on his back: "Before we were married I could cut a lawn twice this big without getting tired!"

7.title: Lawns
7.author: by Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Carlyle's making money cutting lawns for neighbors, and Pop wants to join him.

8.title: Lawns
8.author: by Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Waldo was going to hire Carlyle to cut the lawn, until he heard the estimate.

9.title: Lawns
9.author: by Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Waldo mops the floor, mows the lawn, and trims the hedge, and is told how lucky he is not to have to work on Saturdays.

10.title: Lawns
10.author: J
10.series: Apr. 19, 1948) "A Son of Mine! Scalped Sod He Brings!"*
notes: Summary: Sent to the vacant lot to get sod for the lawn, he finds other people have taken the first layer so he brings a wheelbarrow full of the second layer.
(Why Mothers Get Gray).

11.title: Lawns
11.author: by Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Carlyle wants to work hard and be an Eagle Scout, and Pop with the push mower suggests he could start by clipping the edges of the lawn.

12.title: Lawns
12.author: [No author]
12.series: Nov. 1952) "You Cawn't Dig in the Marster's Lawn!"*
notes: Flub is a dog.

13.title: Lawns
13.author: produced by Wm C
notes: Educational comic book about growing and chemically fertilizing lawns, and flower and vegetable gardens.

14.title: Lawns
14.author: Clark.
14.series: June 10, 1955) "We Stayed Home All Those Years While He Studied Nights. Now He's an Executive and Trying to Break 80 at Golf"
notes: Situation: Two women talking over their backyard fences; a push mower leans against a house in an unmowed lawn.

15.title: Lawns
15.author: [No author]
15.series: Apr. 12, 1958) "Stand By to Catch the Lifeline, Major"
notes: Summary: The Major is launching a lawn project, but the wind is blowing the grass seed away. Jason figures he'd better rescue him.

16.title: Lawns
16.author: Henry Boltinoff, script and art ; Gaspar Saladino, letters
16.series: Feb. 1959) "Mowing the Lawn, Great Way to Meet Girls"*
notes: Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

17.title: Lawns
17.author: Neg Cochran.
notes: Summary: His research on drought-resistant grass doesn't impress his friends, who would prefer not to have a better lawn and the work that comes with it.

18.title: Lawns
18.author: J
18.series: June 7, 1965) "Anywhere, Just So We Get Him"*
notes: (Why Mothers Get Gray)
Summary: He has sculpted a cartoon face into the front lawn with the mower, and mother and sister are out looking for him.

19.title: Lawns
19.author: Gill Fox.
19.series: Oct. 9, 1965) "I Keep Telling Dorothy She's Got to Learn to Control that Nervous Energy"
notes: Summary: He's in a hammock while Dorothy scowls and attacks the lawn with a sickle.

20.title: Lawns
20.author: Harold Gray.
20.series: Apr. 1, 1968) "The A'mighty Made Grass for Walkin' on, Same as Folks Makes Carpets!"*
notes: Summary: Annie sees people working on lawns and gardens around the mansion, and apologizes for walking on the grass.
Summary: PN6726 f.B55 "grass"

21.title: Lawns
21.author: by George Clark.
21.series: Aug. 11, 1971) "Uncle Charlie Adapted to Automation 20 Years Ago"
notes: Summary: Uncle Charlie's in his hammock, and his push mower is almost hidden in the tall grass of his lawn.

22.title: Lawns
22.author: by Bruce Walthers
22.series: 1972) "Community Service, Law'n Order, Fiscal Responsibility, and Patriotism"*

23.title: Lawns
23.author: David Michelinie, script ; Sergio Aragones, art

24.title: Lawns
24.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Reggie dumps dirty beach sand on Archie's front lawn, and Archie finds valuables in it.

25.title: Lawns
25.author: Ketcham.
25.series: May 27, 1982) "I Think He's Planting some New Crabgrass"*
notes: Summary: Dennis and Joey see Mr. Wilson using a fertilizer spreader on his lawn.

26.title: Lawns
26.author: Tom Armstrong.
notes: Summary: Marvin hears tiny profane voices in the lawn.

27.title: Lawns
27.author: Ketcham.
27.series: Jan. 16, 1984) "If It Weren't for the Grass Stains, We Couldn't Keep Track of How Many Times We Fell Down"
notes: Setting: Dennis and Joey are playing on the lawn.

28.title: Lawns
28.author: MacNelly.
28.series: Sept. 24, 1985) "I Guess You Lawn Care Pros have a Special Name for This Special Turf"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo's getting a new, lush, natural-looking lawn, and its special name is 'astro'.

29.title: Lawns
29.author: Ketcham.
29.series: Apr. 23, 1984) "And Always Remember to Look Both Ways Before Crossing Mr. Wilson's Lawn"
notes: Summary: Dennis is giving Joey some safety tips.

30.title: Lawns
30.author: Hoest.
30.series: June 10, 1985) "Mowing the Lawn Might Make You Feel Better"
notes: Summary: Loretta offers advice to a bedraggled Leroy in his pajamas.

31.title: Lawns
31.author: Tom Armstrong.
31.series: June 22, 1985) "You Know It's Time to Go on a Diet when you get Grass Stains on your Stomach"*
notes: Setting: Marvin is crawling across the lawn.

32.title: Lawns
32.author: Russell Myers.
32.series: Sept. 12, 1985) "That Explains What Happened to the Rug"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda has to be stopped from using the vacuum cleaner on the lawn.

33.title: Lawns
33.author: MacNelly.
33.series: Nov. 30, 1985) "Now I Got Holes from Cigarette Butts, a Whole Acre to Vacuum, a Four-Wheel Drive Rug Shampoo Tractor with a Carpet Deodorizer Spreader"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo had the 'Marquis d'Sod Lawn Service' install astroturf, and there's no more weeds, seeds, fertilizing or watering.

34.title: Lawns
34.author: Armstrong.
34.series: Mar. 22, 1986) "He's Estimating How Many More Saturdays He's Got Off Before He Has To Start Mowing The Lawn Again"*
notes: Summary: Marvin and a bird sit in the sandbox watching Marvin's dad inspect the lawn.

35.title: Lawns
35.author: Dik Browne
35.series: May 23, 1986) "I Couldn't Stand To See Him So Happy"*
35.appears_in: reproduced (p. 221) in The Best of Hi and Lois, by Mort Walker and Dik Browne (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986)
notes: Summary: Thirsty's wife thinks about divorce. We see him in his lawn chair in the tall grass of his lawn.

36.title: Lawns
36.author: [No author]
36.series: Sept. 20, 1986) "You Wanna See My Leaves Dumped in Your Yard Again This Year, Rutherford?"*
notes: Summary: Rutherford starts by complimenting Jones's lawn, then complains about the guinea pigs in his wife's bath.

37.title: Lawns
37.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: Mamie wants to know why their lawn can't look as good as the neighbor's, and Willy goes next door to ask him to let it go to seed.

38.title: Lawns
38.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: Lady P. puts Lord P. in charge of everything outside that's green and shaggy.

39.title: Lawns
39.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
39.series: July 16, 1987) "The Telephone Number of a Boy Who'll Cut Your Lawn for $4"*
notes: Summary: Lois is selling a house, and offers a bonus to the buyer.

40.title: Lawns
40.author: Ketcham.
40.series: Sept. 5, 1987) "Hey, Dad! You Forgot to Turn Off the Grass Before We Left!"
notes: Summary: The family returns from a trip to a thriving lawn.

41.title: Lawns
41.author: [No author]
41.series: Sept. 5, 1987) "I Wanted Her To See What Our Lawn Could Look Like If She Really Worked At It!"*
notes: Summary: Irma Thurston is joining Hi and Thirsty on the golf course today.

42.title: Lawns
42.author: by Richard Guindon.
notes: Summary: The lawn is dead, but they've got to get on with their lives.

43.title: Lawns
43.author: by Jimmy Johnson.
notes: Summary: Arlo tries to avoid mowing the lawn by saying that tall grass is a good wildlife habitat.

44.title: Lawns
44.author: by Hoest.
44.series: July 27, 1988) "I Have a Lawn Problem Too. I Can't Get Leroy to Mow It"

45.title: Lawns
45.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: From his hammock, Lord P. says the lawn's turning brown is a nice change from all that green.

46.title: Lawns
46.author: Dik Browne.
46.series: July 30, 1988) "The Grass was Tickling My Arms"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty has put his lawn recliner up on sawhorses.

47.title: Lawns
47.author: Graham.
47.series: Aug. 13, 1988) "I Know He's Proud of His Garden, but This Is Ridiculous!"*
notes: Summary: Fred's master orders him off the lawn, because it's just been cut.

48.title: Lawns
48.author: Roba
notes: Summary: A mushroom might be growing in the lawn in the back yard.
Plate no. 998.

49.title: Lawns
49.author: McPherson.
49.series: 1990?) "Vern Considers It a Sign of Weakness if he Empties the Grass Bag Before He's Finished the Lawn"

50.title: Lawns
50.author: Johnson.
50.series: May 16, 1990) "Isn't This Lawn All One Could Ever Want From This Life?!"*
notes: Summary: Arlo praises the lawn to the point of sarcasm.

51.title: Lawns
51.author: Bittle.
51.series: June 9, 1990) "What Have You Got That Will Turn My Lawn Lush, Green and Beautiful Without Me Having to Mow, Edge or Weed It?"*
notes: Summary: Artie visits a nursery.

52.title: Lawns
52.author: Young & Drake.
52.series: July 21, 1990) "Even I Can Only Be Perfect For About A Week"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood laments a brown spot in his perfect lawn, and Blondie says perfection can't last.

53.title: Lawns
53.author: Cullum.
53.series: Feb. 22, 1992) "If There's One Thing A Morning Person Hates, It's Another Morning Person"*
notes: Summary: One guy has already sodded half his lawn; the other guy has washed his car, cleaned the gutters and clipped the hedges.

54.title: Lawns
54.author: Johnson.
54.series: Apr. 14, 1992) "Ok, Ok! So Hire Someone to Mow the Lawn!"*
notes: Summary: Arlo asserts his duty to stimulate the economy.

55.title: Lawns
55.author: Wise-Aldrich.
notes: Summary: Diagram of what happens when a man steps on a rake in the lawn.

56.title: Lawns
56.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
56.series: June 27, 1992) "It's Usually Not Until Mid-July That I Lose Sight of Thirsty"*
notes: Summary: It's been a good year for growing grass; Thirsty is sleeping in his back yard.

57.title: Lawns
57.author: Gary Wise and Lance Aldrich.
57.series: July 2, 1992) "You fertilize your grass so it will grow, then you cut it so it won't be so high, then you swear at it because it grows so fast"

58.title: Lawns
58.author: David Gallagher.
58.series: July 8, 1992) "In a tragic and costly mixup, the grass rolls were delivered inside the builidng and the carpet outside"
notes: Situation: Workers are unrolling sod in an office, and stapling it to the floor.

59.title: Lawns
59.author: Young & Drake.
59.series: Aug. 11, 1992) "From Now On, I'm Going to Cultivate Weeds and I'll Pull Out Any Grass that Grows"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood tells Blondie his new idea for the lawn, and she puts him in a hammock with lemonade.

60.title: Lawns
60.author: by Mort Walker.
60.series: Sept. 8, 1992) "What Doth It Profit a Man?"*
notes: Summary: Beetle inquires about the job mowing the chapel lawn.

61.title: Lawns
61.author: Cullum.
61.series: Mar. 31, 1993) "I Never Realized Sod Was Such A Hot Commodity"*
notes: Summary: The girls have had a successful lawn sale.

62.title: Lawns
62.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: A bug in Thirsty's lawn feels secure in the tall grass.

63.title: Lawns
63.author: Kirkman & Scott.
63.series: July 8, 1993) "Pretty Soon There Will Be Another Lawn In The Neighborhood That Looks As Neglected As Ours"*
notes: Summary: Mike and Yolanda are going to have a baby.

64.title: Lawns
64.author: by Stephen Bentley.
64.series: Sept. 7, 1993) "Finally Getting Around to Cutting My Lawn"*
notes: Summary: Herb's neighbor Mr. Torpid is cutting his tall grass with hedge clippers.

65.title: Lawns
65.author: Russell Myers.
65.series: Apr. 18, 1994) "Buddy, If I Kill the Weeds I Won't Have a Lawn"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda is buying fertilizer, but without herbicides.

66.title: Lawns
66.author: Hoest & Reiner.
66.series: July 1, 1994) "Leroy Will Have to Mow the Lawn Now. He Can't Find His Hammock"

67.title: Lawns
67.author: Ketcham.
67.series: Aug. 18, 1994) "Mr. Wilson Says If We Ever Move, He's Gonna Give Me the Biggest Goin'-Away Party Anybody Ever Had!"
notes: Situation: Mr. Mitchell is doing something to his lawnmower, with Mr. Wilson watering his lawn in the background.

68.title: Lawns
68.author: by Schulz.
68.series: Nov. 14, 1994) "The Secret of Life is to be Older than your Lawn"*
notes: Summary: Franklin's grampa has a profound new philosophy.

69.title: Lawns
69.author: Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: The grass is so tall you can't see out the front window.

70.title: Lawns
70.author: [No author]
70.series: July 15, 1995) "How Come You Don't Want the Lawn to Grow Up to be Big and Tall?"
notes: Situation: Mr. Mitchell is changing the oil in his lawnmower.

71.title: Lawns
71.author: Cullum-Marshall.
71.series: Sept. 2, 1995) "I've Found Green Spray Paint on my Lawn Works Just as Well"*
notes: Summary: He doesn't like the artificiality of having a lawn service put chemicals on his yard.

72.title: Lawns
72.author: Robert Gill.
72.series: Sept. 2, 1995) "You Know How My Dad Hates to Cut the Lawn"*
notes: Summary: Dad's getting artificial turf.

73.title: Lawns
73.author: Jim Davis.
notes: Garfield is sleeping in a patch of tall grass in the middle of an otherwise mown lawn.

74.title: Lawns
74.author: Jim Davis.
74.series: Apr. 4, 1997) "All Right, All Right! I'll Mow the Lawn!"*
notes: Summary: Odie and Garfield suit up for a safari to go out and get the newspaper.

75.title: Lawns
75.author: by Brian Crane.
75.series: May 7, 1997) "Do You Ever Stop and Think about Lawns?"*
notes: Summary: Earl was raised on a farm with crops like wheat, alfalfa and corn, but now he's got a lawn and he thinks they're useless. Like cats.

76.title: Lawns
76.author: by Brian Crane.
76.series: May 8, 1997) "What Are You Doing to the Lawn, Earl?"*
notes: Summary: Earl is plowing the lawn under to plant oats.

77.title: Lawns
77.author: by Brian Crane.
77.series: May 9, 1997) "What This Country Needs is Fewer Lawns and More Amber Waves of Grain"*
notes: Summary: Earl doesn't think planting oats in the front yard is ridiculous.

78.title: Lawns
78.author: by Brian Crane.
78.series: June 4, 1997) "We Don't Have a Lawn Anymore. We Planted Oats, Remember?"*
notes: Summary: Nelson wants to earn money by mowing the lawn; Gramps hires him to be a scarecrow.

79.title: Lawns
79.author: by Dave Coverly.
79.series: Sept. 6, 1997) "If You Don't Mind, Ted, I Prefer to Do My Business on the Lawn"
notes: Summary: A rodent in a business suit seems about to step away from his desk.

80.title: Lawns
80.author: Jim Davis.
80.series: Oct. 13, 1997) "There Had Better Be Food on the Front Lawn"*
notes: Summary: Jon says the world's exciting.

81.title: Lawns
81.author: [No author]
81.series: May 4, 1998) "If It Wasn't for the Crab Grass We Wouldn't Have Any Green At All!"*
notes: Summary: Brutus and Gladys look out the window at their lawn.

82.title: Lawns
82.author: Mac.
82.series: May 8, 1998) "We Have the Most Resplendent Grounds North of the Mason-Dixon Line, and You're the Sexiest Hunk Alive"*
notes: Summary: Ted rejects Sally's first attempt to compliment his lawn.

83.title: Lawns
83.author: Mac ; created by Greg Howard.
notes: Summary: How come Dad's comparing lawns with the neighbors?

84.title: Lawns
84.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Hagar's siege of a castle has to be called off because of a sign in the front yard.

85.title: Lawns
85.author: [No author]
85.series: July 25, 1998) "PJ! Walketh Not in Green Pastures!"
notes: Summary: 'Keep off the grass' paraphrased for the church lawn.

86.title: Lawns
86.author: Gilbert.
86.series: Aug. 3, 1998) "I Think It's Time to Mow the Lawn, Paul"*
notes: Summary: Buckles is playing hyena. He steals hamburgers from the picnic table of the lions, and disappears into the tall grass of the African plains.

87.title: Lawns
87.author: Lynn.
87.series: Feb. 18, 1999) "They Appeared Mysteriously in the Night"*
notes: Summary: 50 flamingos have appeared on the front lawn on his 50th birthday.

88.title: Lawns
88.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Dr. Patterson tricks his staff to find out who put the flamingos on his lawn.

89.title: Lawns
89.author: M
89.series: Mar. 20, 1999) "A Little Exercise would do you a World of Good, Bruno"*
notes: Summary: Fergus mowing the lawn with a push mower, and finds Bruno grown over with grass and flowers.

90.title: Lawns
90.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi tells Thirsty he shouldn't make Irma mow the lawn. Thirsty agrees.

91.title: Lawns
91.author: M
notes: Summary: The lawn is growing so fast that he has to mow non-stop.

92.title: Lawns
92.author: B
92.series: May 31, 1999) "Makes You Wonder Just How Green It Will Get"*
notes: Summary: The same thought applies both to the lawn, and to the annual salaray review.

93.title: Lawns
93.author: by Tom Batiuk and Chris Ayers.
notes: Summary: Crankshaft puts a match to his barbecue, and doesn't notice he's ignited the lawn as well.

94.title: Lawns
94.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
94.series: July 9, 1999) "Look at the Bright Side. We Won't Have to Mow It for a While!"*
notes: Summary: The grass fire has destroyed two lawns and the fence between.

95.title: Lawns
95.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
95.series: July 10, 1999) "Done! I Say We Celebrate with a Barbecue!"*
notes: Summary: The lawns have just been re-seeded from the grass fire caused by the last barbecue.

96.title: Lawns
96.author: Ketcham.
96.series: July 13, 1999) "Wow! Mr. Wilson Sure Planted a Bunch of Pretty Dandelions This Year"
notes: Summary: The boys are enjoying Mr. Wilson's lawn, and in the background he's spraying it.

97.title: Lawns
97.author: Wiley.
97.series: July 29, 1999) "Man's First Step in Wasting Time on Weekends"
notes: Summary: A cave man invents the lawn.

98.title: Lawns
98.author: B
98.series: Aug. 9, 1999) "Did You Put Any Fertilizer on the Lawn This Year?"*
notes: Summary: The result would be needing to mow it more often, so the answer is no.

99.title: Lawns
99.author: Brookins.
99.series: Aug. 13, 1999) "If It Weren't for the Weeds, a Plugger's Lawn Wouldn't be Nearly as Green"

100.title: Lawns
100.author: by Larry Wright.
100.series: Aug. 17, 1999) "I Really Don't Think You Have to Do That to Astroturf"
notes: Summary: Kit is watering the lawn on her balcony.

101.title: Lawns
101.author: Brad Anderson.
101.series: Oct. 23, 1999) "He Cut Across a Few Lawns"
notes: Summary: Marmaduke comes home tangled in lawn signs.

102.title: Lawns
102.author: Julie Larson.
notes: Summary: A man walking his dog passes the Penny's lawn.

103.title: Lawns
103.author: Duffy.
103.series: Feb. 5, 2000) "We Call it Edging the Roaches"*
notes: Summary: Compares the suburban satisfaction of edging the lawn with the urban equivalent, spraying the baseboards.

104.title: Lawns
104.author: Jim Unger.
104.series: Mar. 14, 2000) "The Forecast Said There's a 50% Chance of Rain, So He's Watering Half the Lawn"

105.title: Lawns
105.author: B
notes: Summary: Grampa's guarding the lawn.

106.title: Lawns
106.author: by Dick Guindon.
106.series: Apr. 26, 2000) "Bo Stood and Shushed the Table. He Thought He Heard His Lawn Calling"
notes: Repeated on Aug. 6, 2001.

107.title: Lawns
107.author: Stantis.
107.series: July 10, 2000) "Gravel! About Five Tons Ought to Cover It"*
notes: Summary: Larry considers an alternative to mowing the lawn.

108.title: Lawns
108.author: Parker.
108.series: July 11, 2000) "Leave It On My Attorney's Front Lawn"*
notes: Summary: The king asks the condemned man what they should do with his body.

109.title: Lawns
109.author: Stantis.
notes: Summary: Larry knows why the Browns work so hard on their perfect lawn.

110.title: Lawns
110.author: Johnson.
110.series: July 14, 2000) "This Watering Ban Won't Last Forever"*
notes: Summary: Arlo gloats because the neighbor's lawn, with it's fertilizer, weed killer and sprinkler system, doesn't look any better than his.

111.title: Lawns
111.author: Wiley.
111.series: Aug. 17, 2000) "Look at the Bright Side, We Don't Have a Lawn to Mow"*
notes: Summary: Two prisoners are clamped to a dungeon wall upside down.
Copyright date is 1996.

112.title: Lawns
112.author: Nicole Hollander.
112.series: Aug. 18, 2000) "Scott's has Stolen My Idea for a Low-Mow Lawn"*
notes: Summary: Clyde the scientist is depressed, but then he comes up with "a grass as soft as bunny fur" for barefoot walking.

113.title: Lawns
113.author: Nicole Hollander.
113.series: Aug. 19, 2000) "She'll Be Green and Purple with Envy"*
notes: (The Woman Who Does Everything more Beautifully than You)
Summary: She's planning a red, white and blue lawn for the next 4th of July.

114.title: Lawns
114.author: Patrick McDonnell.
notes: Summary: This is what the Praying Mantis is praying for.

115.title: Lawns
115.author: Margaret Shulock.
115.series: Aug. 22, 2000) "It Must be a Guy Thing"*
notes: Summary: A sheep in his back yard is standing by his lawnmower and fertilizer, looking over the fence at the greener grass on the other side.

116.title: Lawns
116.author: Art/Chip.
116.series: Aug. 24, 2000) "If I Pull Up the Weeds, There Won't Be Any Green Left in the Lawn at All!"*
notes: Summary: Gladys wants something done about the weeds in the lawn.

117.title: Lawns
117.author: Stantis.
117.series: Sept. 23, 2000) "What Did the Lawn Ever Do To Me?"*
notes: Summary: Cutting the grass doesn't seem like an obvious thing to do.

118.title: Lawns
118.author: Russell Myers.
118.series: Nov. 7, 2000) "I Don't Depend Heavily on Repeat Business!"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda offers to trim a lawn for $5, then zaps it dead with lightning from her finger.

119.title: Lawns
119.author: by Stephen Bentley.
119.series: Nov. 16, 2000) "I Just Water It, Weeds and All"*
notes: Summary: Herb wonders how Mr. Torpid, his neighbor, makes his lawn so green.

120.title: Lawns
120.author: by Johnny Hart.
notes: (Wiley's Dictionary)
Summary: About what to do with lawns.

121.title: Lawns
121.author: Coverly.
121.series: May 11, 2001) "The Grass Always Has Stronger Chemicals on the Other Side of The Fence"*

122.title: Lawns
122.author: Jim Davis.
122.series: June 5, 2001) "You're Blinding Me With Your Logic"*
notes: Summary: Jon says it's too nice out to mow the lawn, so he'll water it instead. Garfield puts on sunglasses.

123.title: Lawns
123.author: by John McPherson.
notes: Summary: Gets rid of people walking their dogs on her lawn.

124.title: Lawns
124.author: Aaron McGruder.
124.series: July 12, 2001) "I Think Your Granddad May Be Onto Something With This Whole 'Lawn Care' Thing"*
notes: Summary: They're trying to play soccer in the yard, but the grass is so tall they can't see the ball.

125.title: Lawns
125.author: by Aldrich & Wise.
125.series: July 16, 2001) "You Can't Shame Someone Who's 100 Percent Pure Sloth"
notes: Summary: The lawn will get edged after they sell the house.

126.title: Lawns
126.author: Jim Davis, Brett Koth.
126.series: June 13, 2002) "I Gave Her My Word Today Was The Day"*
notes: Summary: Mr. Potato Head is talking to his lawn about mowing.

127.title: Lawns
127.author: CantÃº & Castellanos.
127.series: June 14, 2002) "We're Hitting a Little Place I Call Cerca Verde Grass Land!"*
notes: Summary: This summer's vacation is on their own lawn.

128.title: Lawns
128.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
128.series: June 15, 2002) "Well, Look at the Bright Side"*
notes: Summary: The barbecue grill explosion means the crab grass is gone and they won't need to mow the lawn.

129.title: Lawns
129.author: Browne.
129.series: July 19, 2002) "Can We Camp Out In Your Yard, Mr. Thurston?"*
notes: Summary: Dot and Ditto want a wilderness experience, and the neighbor's lawn looks a little less suburban.

130.title: Lawns
130.author: by Jef Mallett.
130.series: July 19, 2002) "That's Where the Bees' Nest Is"*
notes: Summary: The man with the riding mower still gets a workout in the one corner of his tiny lawn.

131.title: Lawns
131.author: by Dick Guindon.
notes: Summary: Lawns are being watered with Perrier.

132.title: Lawns
132.author: by Jerry Scott and Jim Borgman.
notes: Summary: Jeremy has apparently been working on the lawn.

133.title: Lawns
133.author: by Chip Dunham.
133.series: Sept. 22, 2003) "Hey You Wanna Do That on Someone Else's Lawn, Dog?"*
notes: Summary: Louie fantasizes about his trek being made into a Disney movie, with some editing.

134.title: Lawns
134.author: by Dan Piraro.
134.series: Oct. 10, 2003) "It Keeps the Rednecks Off the Lawn"*
notes: Summary: She sprays with classical literature.

135.title: Lawns
135.author: by Ed Stein.
135.series: Apr. 6, 2004) "We Bluegrass Addicts will Relapse and Try to Water"*
notes: Summary: There's a drought, and he's going to an emergency Lawn-Anon meeting.

136.title: Lawns
136.author: by Ed Stein.
136.series: May 31, 2004) "What We're Calling a Drought is Actually Normal for Colorado"*
notes: Summary: Sam tells his lawn it can't stay.

137.title: Lawns
137.author: Art & Chip.
137.series: June 30, 2004) "The Crab Grass Seems to be Thriving on it"*
notes: Summary: Brutus keeps fertilizing his lawn.

138.title: Lawns
138.author: Art-Chip.
138.series: Oct. 1, 2004) "They Do a Nice Job of Covering Up the Crab Grass!"*
notes: Summary: Brutus is reluctant to rake the leaves.

139.title: Lawns
139.author: Jeff and Bil Keane.
139.series: Dec. 24, 2004) "I Think I Heard some Clatter out on the Lawn!"*
notes: Summary: PJ's thinking of 'Twas the Night Before Christmas.

140.title: Lawns
140.author: by Ralph Dunagin and Dana Summers.
140.series: May 9, 2005) "There's Nothing Like the Smell of a Newly Mowed Lawn!"*
notes: Summary: They compare it to grilling, popcorn, and dead possums.

141.title: Lawns
141.author: Amend.
141.series: June 13, 2005) "But If I Water the Lawn, the Grass Will Grow"*
notes: Summary: Peter is reluctant, but Jason says he'll water it.

142.title: Lawns
142.author: by Hector Cantu & Carlos Castellanos.
142.series: June 30, 2005) "Parked on Front Lawns or Only in Their Driveways?"*
notes: Summary: Baldo tries to count the relatives he has with broken-down cars.

143.title: Lawns
143.author: Mark Parisi.
notes: Summary: He saw how much nicer the neighbors' lawns and gardens looked.

144.title: Lawns
144.author: by Patrick McDonnell.
144.series: July 16, 2005) "Where Did My Hand-Held Fan Go?"*
notes: Summary: The humans are in lawn chairs, and the pets have the fan on the lawn under a tree.

145.title: Lawns
145.author: by David Gilbert.
145.series: July 16, 2005) "We Did Trespass and Vandalize her Property"*
notes: Summary: Mrs. Birch's lawn ornaments are not aliens. She chases Buckles and the bird off her lawn.

146.title: Lawns
146.author: Browne.
146.series: July 30, 2005) "Chip, Would You Like a Job?"*
notes: Summary: Looking at Mr. Thurston's tall-grass lawn, Chip rejects the job.

147.title: Lawns
147.author: Brian Basset.
notes: Summary: Red thinks croquet should be the sport of kings.

148.title: Lawns
148.author: by Bill Griffith.
notes: Summary: Zippy does his own dentistry, shoe repairs and lawn edging, but in 1583 life would have been even harder. Of course there would have been no root canals, athlete's foot, Dick Cheney or Olsen twins.

149.title: Lawns
149.author: Chance Browne.
149.series: May 27, 2006) "Just Finish Mowing the Lawn, Chip"*
notes: Summary: Chip has mowed crop circles into the lawn.

150.title: Lawns
150.author: by Tom Batiuk & Chuck Ayers.
notes: Summary: Crankshaft is being pleasant to the neighbors as he fertilizes his lawn.

151.title: Lawns
151.author: Amend.
151.series: Oct. 16, 2006) "When I Was Aerating the Lawn, I Accidentally Cut the Cable TV Line"*

152.title: Lawns
152.author: Jim Toomey.
152.series: June 16, 2007) "My Turtle Grass has Turned All Yellow"*
notes: Summary: Fillmore is studying his lawn encyclopedia, about phases in the life cycle of grass.

153.title: Lawns
153.author: by Jef Mallett.
153.series: July 1, 2008) "You Know How Much the School could Save by Letting the Lawn Go Natural?"*
notes: Summary: Frazz says they'd just find other things for him to do.

154.title: Lawns
notes:
Lawn maintenance plays a part in saving the world in the first Justice League of America story (1960), in which the lime being spread on a lawn shows the way to defeat the aliens. See also under:

  • Dandelions
  • Greens
